name: Jianye Hao
content: Jianye Hao's Homepage Jianye Hao's Homepage Jianye Hao Professor Tianjin University Tianjin, China, 300350 Deep Reinforcement Learning Lab Email jianye.hao@tju.edu.cn Jianye Hao is a Professor at College of Intelligence and Computing ,Tianjin University. Jianye's research focuses on deep reinforcement learning and embodied ai and apply those techniques and methodologies to address large-scale and dynamic decision-making problems including chip design and autonomous driving (collaboration with Huawei), game AI (deployed in a number of commercial game products in Netease), ads display optimization in e-commerce (deployed in Alibaba's Taobao Platform), Wireless network and Data center optimization (collaboration with Huawei) and so on. This page may not be updated frequently. For more information, please visit our lab: rl.beiyang.ren. Education: 2013.9-2015.4: MIT-SUTD Joint Postdoc Researcher 2009.7-2013.7: The Chinese University of Hong Kong , Computer Science and Engineering, PhD 2004.9-2008.7: Harbin Institute of Technology , Computer Science and Technology, Bachelor of Engineering Academic Experience: Visiting Scholar at School of Computer Science and Software Engineering, University of Wollongong, Sep 2014 - Oct 2014, Host: Prof. Minjie Zhang Visiting Scholar at School of Computing, National University of Singapore, July, 2011 - December, 2011, Host:Prof. Jin Song Dong Research: Current research focuses on : Reinforcement Learning Embodied AI See more details at: Research page Selected Publications: Rethinking Decision Transformer via Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning, ICML, 2024 KISA: A Unified Keyframe Identifier and Skill Annotator for Long-Horizon Robotics Demonstrations, ICML, 2024 EvoRainbow: Combining Improvements in Evolutionary Reinforcement Learning for Policy Search, ICML, 2024 Generate Subgoal Images before Act: Unlocking the Chain-of-Thought Reasoning in Diffusion Model for Robot Manipulation with Multimodal Prompts, CVPR, 2024 Uni-RLHF: Universal Platform and Benchmark Suite for Reinforcement Learning with Diverse Human Feedback, ICLR, 2024 AlignDiff: Aligning Diverse Human Preferences via Behavior-Customisable Diffusion Model, ICLR, 2024 Pessimistic value iteration for multi-task data sharing in Offline Reinforcement Learning, Artificial Intelligence (AIJ)ï¼ 2023 åå¼æºè½çç ç©¶ä¸åºç¨, ä¸­å½ç§å­¦Â·ä¿¡æ¯ç§å­¦ï¼ 2023 MetaDiffuser: Diffusion Model as Conditional Planner for Offline Meta-RL, ICML, 2023 RACE: Improve Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning with Representation Asymmetry and Collaborative Evolution, ICML, 2023 ERL-Re2: Efficient Evolutionary Reinforcement Learning with Shared State Representation and Individual Policy Representation, ICLR, 2023 Boosting Multiagent Reinforcement Learning via Permutation Invariant and Permutation Equivariant Networks, ICLR, 2023 EUCLID: Towards Efficient Unsupervised Reinforcement Learning with Multi-choice Dynamics Model, ICLR, 2023 See full publications: Publication page Groups: PhD students: Xiaotian Hao, PhD, 4th year - Learning to optimize using reinforcement learning Yi Ma, PhD, 4th year - Offline reinforcement learning Fei Ni, PhD, 3rd year - Generative modeling and embodied AI Pengyi Li, PhD, 2nd year - Evolutionary reinforcement learning Jinyi Liu, PhD, 2nd year - Offline reinforcement learning and LLM agents Yifu Yuan, PhD, 1st year - RLHF and diffusion models See more details at: Team page Selected Rewards: Best System Paper Award in CoRL 2020:" SMARTS: An Open-Source Scalable Multi-Agent RL Training School for Autonomous Driving", 2020 ACM SIGSOFT Distinguished Paper Award in ASE 2019:" Wuji: Automatic Online Combat Game Testing Using Evolutionary Deep Reinforcement Learning", 2019 Best Paper Award in DAI 2019:" Achieving Cooperation Through Deep Multiagent Reinforcement Learning in Sequential Prisoner's Dilemmas", 2019 CCF Young Scholar Award, 2017-2020. Tianjin Young Talent 1000 Plan, 2015-2018. Second Place in The Fifth International Automated Negotiating Agent Competition (ANAC2015) at AAMAS 2015, Turkey, 2015. Endeavour Research Fellowship, 2014-2015. Champion of The Third International Automated Negotiating Agent Competition (ANAC 2012) at AAMAS 2012 , Spain, 2012. The Best Agent in Discounted Domains in The Third International Automated Negotiating Agent Competition (ANAC 2012) at AAMAS 2012. Global Scholarship for Research Excellence - awarded by The Chinese University of Hong Kong, 2011.
